page.title: 04LANGUAGE
page.content: "Hevva was the cry of the huers who spotted and singalled the huge shoals of fish, especially pilchards. The term'heavy cake' still commonly used is derived from the word hevva'. Hevva also meant a description of crowd bustle or excitment as when some special event had roused the interest of the community"a brag' ol'hevva on the pier". Fishermen would gather on the'gow'a place of talk, or the name for a crowd of men chatting. Woe betide any youngster who butted in he would probably receive a corrective 'Scat aross the chaks"to put him in his place.
